A minimalist visualization of Coronavirus rates

Made with Shiny and R
R
Author

Mike Mahoney

Published

April 27, 2020

I had been getting frustrated with not being able to quickly find coronavirus data for my area, and not being able to see recent trends without framing and interpretation. So I grabbed down the John Hopkins CSSE data and made a quick Shiny app to visualize case and death rates. Iâ€™m trying to not contribute to the constant noise surrounding the ongoing pandemic, but having a way to see these numbers without an overwhelming amount of surrounding editorialization has made me feel like I understand the world a bit better.

knitr::include_graphics("covid.png")

The app lives at this link. Thanks to R Studio, who are providing free hosting for coronavirus apps through the pandemic.
